text: Bottle at sakemaker Vancouver. Brighter and maybe a little crisper than the Nama but not as sweet. Still nice notes of banana, even Apple. A touch of booze. Nice sake.

75 cl bottle, 18%. On June 19, 2015. At Osake Craft Sake Brewery, in Vancouver, British Columbia.Clear inside of pear color, no head, plenty of thick legs. Pear, alcohol, buttery scent. Tart, vinous, alcohol taste. Warming alcohol. Alcohol aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, tart wood finish.
Bottle - Strong melon and dried pineapple and blue cheese notes. Light pale yellow. Dried sweet fruit, more cheesy notes. Robust and nice for my abused palate. Nice.

Sampled at Osake, pours a clear yellowish white. Nose is sort of vinous, with white wine and a touch of fruit. Flavour is fairly boozy, with white wine and light melon fruitiness. Not as good as the Junmai Nama, but still quite nice.

Bottle @ Artisan Sake. Clear off-white/pale yellow. Fumey. Alcohol, apple peels, grape, and rice milk. Slight licorice. Flavor is kind of assertive. Milky flavor, almost creamy. Dry, sort of floral and acidic. Green apple and unripe berry. A touch hot in the finish. My least favorite of the four I tried.

Tasted at the tasting room.  Bright fruity nose.  Fairly peppery aroma.  Quite a bit hotter than the Junmai Nama - there is a very arugula like peppery character.  Some light melon and a sort of asian pear flavour with an almost creamy sweet cherimoya like fruitiness.  Fuller palate with a bit of lingering spiciness.  A touch of softness on the back of the palate.
Flavour is sweet with a large alcohol finish. Very faint yellow body. i found this a little too strong and tasteless with just the alcohol showing through.

Bottle at the breweryPale yellow color. The aroma is actually bolder than the watered version, featuring pear, melon, more alcohol and glue. Sweetish flavor, with bitter almonds. Pleasant alcohol warmth in the final.Good.

Bottle: Pours a yellowish beige color with light legs. The nose is full of cedar and lychee, some banana and a nice dose of koji. The impact is thick and sweet with a light medicinal and dusty finish in the mouthfeel. A bit cloying somewhat, but the acidity is pretty high to try to offset that so it doesnt taste it. Still comes through though. Very medicinal herbal finish with more of the cedar and dusty notes. I could have used something a little cleaner tasting, higher SMV and lower acidity. For the pros though; the alcohol is well hidden.

Sample, from a bottle, drank on site on August 4 2008; eye: clear; nose: alcohol, fruity, light rice, netted melon; mouth: alcohol, fruit concentrate, finale in alcohol with dryness from the rice, lightly liqueur-like; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon d’une bouteille, bue sur place le 4 août 2008; oeil : claire; nez : alcool, fruité, léger riz, cantaloup; bouche : alcool, concentré de fruits, finale en alcool avec sécheresse du riz, légèrement liquoreux; en résumé : pas mal bon

Rice, pears, black pepper and lychee are apparent in the lightly smoky aroma.  Clear pale body is quite viscous and leaves beautiful legs on the glass.  Vanilla, rice, pears and bread are the predominant flavours with alcohol also quite notable.  Texture borders on syrupy but strong warming shows its strength and keeps it from cloying.  Bottle sampled at Wazubees in Summer 2007.

Gorgeous legs on this one.  Only the slightest bit of green to it.  Brawnier aroma than its stablemates, putting the accent on the woody, peppery alcohol with almost a whole grain bread note.  Rich, full flavour.  Full of bready, complex grains, hint of peaches.  Very dry, muscular.
